Description: Nutrient Database Number, a USDA Database unique identifier for the food product
Full name for the product, natural language

EncodedCategories: GDSN = Global Data Synchronization Network via 1WorldSync, LI = Label Insight

Description: A unique code identifying a specific product: either UPC (Universal Product Code) or GTIN (Global Trade Item Number)
The company that makes the product
Last date the data was updated
First date the data was available
Product ingredients, as a comma separated list of ingredients in English
Amount of nutrient per 100g of edible food portion

EncodedCategories: g = grams, mg = milligrams, mcg = microgram, IU = international unit (biological effect), kcal = kilocalories

Description: Quantity of one serving of the product
Unit of measure for the serving size.
Indicates if the serving info is for a prepared or unprepared product (e.g. popped or kernel popcorn)
